result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase A Marceau

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Chase A Marceau in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Chase A Marceau.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Olivares is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a school resource officer with the Wisconsin rapids police department. Testifies to being dispatched to a call of a physical disturbance taking place. Testifies to not seeing anyone when he arrived on scene. Testifies to getting a phone call later to meet w/ the defendant about the incident. Attorney Kryshak stipulates to identification. Testifies to statements made by the defendant. Testifies to viewing the video the defendant showed him w/ what happened. Testifies to what he saw on the video. Testifies to the video showing the defendant striking ADT more than one time. Testifies to being able to see the defendant striking the victim in the face, walking away, and then coming back and striking him again. Testifies to a second video showing the defendant pulling out a pocket knife from ADT's pocket. Another officer spoke w/ the victim and observed his injuries. Testifies to the victim telling the other officer he did not give the defendant consent to being hit and how many times he was hit. Testifies to the victim having to go to the hospital because of the injuries. Testifies to the injuries. 
Attorney Kryshak cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to not following up on the hospital records of the victim. Testifies to the video he was watching not having any sound. 

Attorney Kryshak moves to miss the felony. Attorney Knaapen gives an argument for the charges being charged as they are.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 

Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:48 PM Defendant Chase A Marceau in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant states that Attorney Kryshak will be assigned this case and he spoke with his attorney and is asking for a continuance. Court grants and finds good reason to go out of time limits. Bond is continued.

Prior: 330 7th St S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chase A Marceau in court.

No contact w/victim or their residence - ADT. 
Must reside at his fathers house.
